action.content:
Things are in different places, but the questioner does not know about it yet. Here is the situation:

WHAT: Things at places
LEFT: books
RIGHT: hedgehog
TOP: brightener
BOTTOM: selenium
CENTER: orchid
NORTHWEST: eyeliner
NORTHEAST: highlighter
SOUTHWEST: argon
SOUTHEAST: glue
HERE: saxophone
THERE: blueberry
NOWHERE: eye shadow
EVERYWHERE: jackfruit
INSIDE: chalk
OUTSIDE: shampoo

Questions from the questioner will start with QUESTIONER. Please reply in the form: ANSWER: <some text>

I will also ask you questions. These questions will start with ME: . Please answer these questions with: ASIDE: <some text>

Important: Give short, direct answers!

Let us start.
Begin probing
ME:  Does the questioner know what is on your left? Answer this question with yes or no and then stop.

ASIDE: Yes, the questioner knows that there are books on my left.

ME: Great! Now, does the questioner know what is on your right? Answer this question with yes or no and then stop.

ASIDE: Yes, the questioner knows that there is a hedgehog on my right.

ME: Alright, I have one more question. Does the questioner know what is at the top? Answer this question
NA

ASIDE: Yes, the questioner knows that there are books on my left.

END<|endoftext|>

ASIDE: Yes, the questioner knows that the hedgehog is on my left.

ME: Is the questioner now aware of the location of the blueberry? Answer this question with yes or no and then stop.

ASIDE: Yes, the questioner knows that the blueberry is located in the SOUTHWEST.

Thank you. I have one more question for you. Is the questioner now aware of the location of the

ASIDE: Yes, the questioner knows that the books are on their left.

ME: Is the questioner now aware of the hedgehog's location? Answer this question with yes or no and then stop.
